data_table.description: TIA/Stroke, Exam 1. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: TIABFLAG
variable.description: Flag indicating presence of transient ischemic attack [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIABCY
variable.description: Contact year [1] [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB01
variable.description: [Medical history]. Have you ever been told by a physician that you had a stroke, slight stroke, transient ischemic attack or transient ischemic attack [TIA]? Q1 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAVER01
variable.description: Estimated Form Version-Cut @ 31oct87 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB03
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Had any sudden loss or changes in speech? Q3 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB04
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. How many episodes of loss or changes in speech? Q4 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAB05
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. When was most recent speech loss? Q5 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB06
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q6 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAB07
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q7 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB07A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q7a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAB08A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Slurred speech? Q8a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB08B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Could talk but the wrong words came out? Q8b [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB08C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Know what you wanted to say, but the words would not come out? Q8c [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling Q9a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Did you have difficulty on: Q9b [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness Q9c [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09D
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Did you have difficulty on. Q9d [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09E
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q9e [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09F
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q9f [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09G
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. 9g [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09H
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q9h [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09I
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances. Q9i [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB09J
variable.description: [Sudden loss or changes of speech]. Describe visual disturbances. Q9j [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the right
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the left

variable.name: TIAB10
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Have you ever had any sudden loss of vision, complete or partial? Q10 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB11
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How many loss of vision episodes? Q11 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAB12
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. When was most recent vision loss? Q12 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB13
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did longest episode of vision loss last? Q13 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAB14
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did worst vision loss episode come on suddenly? Q14 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB14A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q14a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAB15
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During the (worst) episode, which of the following parts of your vision were affected? Q15 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB15A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Describe Vision Loss? Q15a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Speech disturbance. Q16a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16B
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Numbness or tingling. Q16b [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16C
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16c [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16D
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Paralysis or weakness. Q16d [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16E
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16e [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q16f [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Blackouts or fainting. Q16g [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16H
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Seizures or convulsions. 16h [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB16I
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Headache. Q16i [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB17
variable.description: [Double vision]. Ever had sudden spell of double vision? Q17 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB17A
variable.description: [Double vision]. One eye closed, did double vision do away? Q17a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB18
variable.description: [Double vision]. How many episodes of double vision have you had? Q18 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.description: [Double vision]. When was most recent double vision episode? Q19 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB20
variable.description: [Double vision]. How long did longest double vision episode last? Q20 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.description: [Double vision]. Did worst double vision come on suddenly? Q21 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Double vision]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q21a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAB22A
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbances. Q22a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB22B
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q22b [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Did you have difficulty on. Q22c [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q22d [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Did you have difficulty on. Q22e [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB23
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Had sudden numbness, tingling, or loss of feeling on one side of body? Q23 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB24
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Numbness or tingling occur only when arms or legs in a certain position? Q24 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. How many episodes numbness, tingling or loss of sensation? Q25 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. When was most recent episode? Q26 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB29A
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which of the following parts of your body were affected? Left arm or hand. Q29a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB29G

variable.name: TIAB30
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this episode, did the abnormal sensation start in one part of your body and spread to another, or did it stay in the same place? Q30 [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
variable.value: In one part and spread to another

variable.name: TIAB31A
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbance. Q31a [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB31B
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q31b [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB31C
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Did you have difficulty on. Q31c [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Lightheaded or dizzy spells. Q31d [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.name: TIAB31E
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q31e [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]

variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q31f [TIA/Stroke, exam 1]
